alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut and southeast New York, including the following counties, in southern Connecticut, Fairfield and New Haven. In southeast New York, Putnam and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Residual flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM EDT, Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen across the area, resulting in elevated river and stream flows, and water still over some adjacent roadways. - Additional light to moderate rainfall is possible later this afternoon into evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stamford, Waterbury, Danbury, Shelton, Naugatuck, Southbury, New Canaan, Wolcott, Mount Kisco, Mahopac, Lake Carmel, Sherman, Brewster, Newtown, Greenwich, Trumbull, Cheshire, Ridgefield, Monroe and Bethel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
